alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL CHERRY AND CENTRAL SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM MDT... At 711 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rushville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Clinton, Billys Lake, Lone Butte, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River, Rock Hill, Bayonne, Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road, and Argo Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 81 and 120. Highway 250 between mile markers 32 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
